entry.title: Re: Identity Provisioning Service(IPS)-Assigning Custom Attributes to IAS Users with Transformation
entry.content:
Hi @Yogananda , 
Thank you for sharing your insights.

Few points i noticed - 

1)

From the code updated above - i understand, you are hard coding the value "Germany" as it's maintained as constant. So it will be updating all the users getting synced to target with customattribute1 as Germany?

I understand similar thing will happen in second scenario where CustomAttribute2 will be written as "CustomAttribute2" for every user?

Or will it be working differently? Is it the use case or there will be attributes read from SF or S4hana (mentioned source system)

2)

Also you mentioned that first five customAttributes (customAttribute1 to customAttribute5) are typically reserved for SAC - Teams mapping. So in this scenario - are you using IAS as source system and SAC as target system , so that correct teams are assigned after reading values from Custom attributes from IAS? And from where we will populate them? Request you explain the flow. 

Regards

entry.title: Re: ЁЯФР Strengthening SAP BTP Security: SSO with Cloud Connector Using Token-Based Auth (Replacing SU
entry.content:
Hi @MatthiasL , 

I think you are talking about this one - https://me.sap.com/notes/0003632133 - 3632133 - Automatic Renewal of Subaccount Certificates in SAP Cloud Connector

This feature is only supported for few subaccounts and Cloud Connector version 2.18.0 or later

Note: The availability of the Auto Renewal feature is region-dependent. If the toggle switch is not visible in the Cloud Connector UI or the SAP BTP cockpit, it indicates that the feature has not yet been activated for that specific cloud region. It will become available once the toggle appears.

How Renewal Works

  • The renewal is triggered n + 7 days before certificate expiry, where n is the alert threshold (configurable in Observation Configuration -> Alerting)
  • If the renewal attempt fails, it is retried every 12 hours
  • If not successful within 7 days, the automatic renewal is cancelled

Customers who are using latest cloud connectors can leverage this functionality.

Regards

entry.title: Re: Issue with Override of Complete Delivery Flag in Sale...
entry.content: @Lakshmipathi тАФ thank you for your quick inputs. As a practical workaround, we are considering not setting the Complete Delivery indicator by default for webshop customers in the master data. Instead, the indicator will be controlled dynamically through the payload тАФ meaning it will only be enabled when specifically required, or left disabled otherwise. This way, the flag is managed flexibly at order creation rather than being enforced globally at the customer level.

entry.title: Re: Mastering Custom Integrations in SAP Datasphere: Leveraging Open Connectors for REST APIs
entry.content:
Hi, thanks for the great blog post!

I followed the steps exactly as described:

  • Installed Integration Suite and Open Connectors

  • response model defined

  • Created the custom connector, created an instance, and tested it тЖТ HTTP 200

  • In SAP Datasphere, created and tested the Open Connectors connection тЖТ connection works

When I create a Data Flow, I can see the connection and the table. However, as soon as I try to use it I get this error:

Getting dataset definition failed for /spells. HTTP 404: {"requestId":"68ab6129e4b06856503d9995","message":"No object metadata found for 'spells'."}

IтАЩm using the HP API endpoint (/spells) as the source.

thanks again!

entry.title: Re: Park and Post with workflow for journal entries - Is...
entry.content:
Hello @sivasankarans 

The process you are referring to is indeed delivered via the General Journal Entry Verification workflow scenario WS02800046, together with the related Verify General Journal Entries Fiori apps.

How it works (MakerтАУChecker principle)

  • A user parks a journal entry using the app Post General Journal Entries тАУ With Workflow (F0718A).
  • The workflow then routes this parked entry to the designated approversтАЩ My Inbox in Fiori.
  • Once approved, the system automatically posts the journal entry to the ledger.

Configuration Highlights:

  • Activate the workflow via SPRO at:
    Financial Accounting тЖТ General Ledger тЖТ Document тЖТ Document Parking тЖТ Define Workflow Settings.
  • Approval rules can be easily set up using the Business Rule Framework plus (BRF+), allowing you to define criteria such as the amount, company code, or cost. This flexible system helps streamline your approval process center.
  • The delivered workflow template WS02800046 can be copied and expanded to suit your organisational requirements.

Key Fiori Apps:

  • Post General Journal Entries тАУ With Workflow
  • Verify General Journal Entries тАУ For Requester
  • My Inbox for workflow task approvals.

References for further details:

  • SAP Help тАУ Workflow for General Journal Entry Verification
  • SAP Community Blogs discussing workflow scenario WS02800046 and its configuration
  • Fiori Apps Library: Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification
  • 2962635 - Workflow does not get triggered when posting through App Post General Journal Entries (F0718)

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issues with creating Signup page
entry.content:
Hi @God_of_Mates 

The error Account Creation FAILED means that the payload you are sending is not in the exact format Firebase expects.

These are the common Issues in Your Setup

  1. Firebase Auth requires email and password fields
  • The JSON must be:

{

  "email": "user@example.com",

"password": "mypassword",

"returnSecureToken": true

}

  • In your screenshot, the Record formula looked like this:

{email: pageVars.facilityemail, password: pageVars.password, returnSecureToken: true}

  • That is correct in principle but you must confirm that:
      • pageVars.facilityemail actually contains a valid email string.
      • pageVars.password is at least 6 characters. Firebase enforces this.
  1. Your Firebase API endpoint
    • You must call the Firebase REST API with your projectтАЩs Web API key, e.g.:

https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/v1/accounts:signUp?key=YOUR_API_KEY

    • If your Create Record resource isnтАЩt pointing to this URL, Firebase will reject it.
  1. Create Record vs Create User
    • In Build Apps, Create Record is for database collections e.g. Firestore or AppGyver Cloud DB.
    • For Firebase Authentication, you should use a REST API direct integration and POST to the URL above.
    • If you are mixing the two, you will always get FAILED status because it is not hitting the Firebase Auth endpoint.

 

Here is how you can fix it:

  1. Set up a REST API Data Resource

Resource URL:

https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/v1/accounts:signUp?key=YOUR_API_KEY

Method: POST

Request body type: JSON

Schema:

{

 "email": "string",

 "password": "string",

 "returnSecureToken": true

}

  1. Bind your Button тЖТ POST call
    • Instead of Create Record, bind your button logic to POST тЖТ Signup.
    • Record formula stays the same:
    • {email: pageVars.facilityemail, password: pageVars.password, returnSecureToken: true}
  1. Test with a simple email
    • e.g. testuser@gmail.com, password mypassword123.
    • If this works, your problem was the data binding or wrong endpoint.
  1. Optional: Store additional fields (facility name, description)
    • Firebase Auth only stores email + password.
    • To save extra data, you need to also insert into a Firestore or Realtime Database after the Auth call succeeds.

Here is my recommendation

Right now, your button is pointing to Create Record in SignupUsers. That is why it fails. Firebase expects Auth endpoint, not DB insert.

Change your data resource to a REST API POST to accounts:signUp with your API key.
Then, after success, call Create Record in your own DB to save facility info.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to use an unofficial SMS vendor in SAP Emarsys?
entry.content:
Hello SAP team,

 

Our client is currently working with an SMS provider called 360nrs. We understand that this provider is not an official SAP partner.

We would like to know your recommendation regarding this case so we can properly advise our client. Additionally, if you have any official documentation or a link with further details, it would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance for your guidance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to use an unofficial SMS vendor in SAP Emarsys?
entry.content:
Hello,

According to KBA 3459026 - How to integrate SAP Emarsys with a custom SMS provider, the SMS partner API integration allows partners and vendors to integrate with SMS channel.

The complete documentation for the API used to integrate SAP Emarsys with any provider at the following websites is available below:

  • SAP Emarsys SMS Partner Service
  • SAP Emarsys SMS Partner API Documentation

The first step is to send an email to SAP Emarsys SMS Team with the data described at the document below. After that, SMS team will contact back with the next steps.

  • SAP Emarsys SMS Partner API Onboarding

In case of any questions, please use the email <team-sms@emarsys.com> to ask for more details directly to SAP Emarsys SMS team.

 

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Fallback method for opening web applications in iframe if loading fails
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to implement a fallback mechanism for opening a web application inside an iframe. If the app fails to load in the iframe, I want to automatically open it in a new browser tab.

HereтАЩs are the implementations that I have tried so far, I am providing a brute code of the methods that I have tried implementing:

onTilePress: function (oEvent) {
    var sUrl = oEvent.getSource().getBindingContext("appModel").getProperty("url");
    var oFrame = this.byId("appFrame");

    // attachAfterRendering for iframe handling
    oFrame.attachAfterRendering({ url: sUrl }, function (oEvent, oData) {
        var iframe = document.querySelector("iframe");

        if (!iframe) {
            console.error("Iframe not found");
            return;
        }

        // Listen for load success/failure
        iframe.onload = function () {
            console.log("App loaded successfully in iframe");
        };

        iframe.onerror = function () {
            console.error("Error loading app in iframe, opening in new tab");
            window.open(oData.url, "_blank");
        };

        // Safety fallback - message event listener
        window.addEventListener("message", function (e) {
            console.log("Message received from origin:", e.origin);
            // Expected origin is from embedded app, but I only get the portal origin here
        });

        // Detach afterrendering after execution
        oFrame.detachAfterRendering();
    });
}

 

Challenges I am facing:

  1. iframe.onload and iframe.onerror are never triggered тАУ not even for successful apps.

  2. onAfterRendering only detects the UI5 HTML control render, not the internal iframe load state.

  3. When listening for postMessage, I get the custom portal origin (e.g., https://port8081-workspaces...) instead of the embedded appтАЩs origin, so I cannot distinguish failures correctly.


    Can someone please help me to find a correct way to detect if an app inside an iframe has failed to load in SAP UI5 (so that I can implement a proper fallback to open it in a new tab)?
    Also suggest if is there a recommended UI5 mechanism to achieve this?

    Thanks in advance,
    Sai Krishna.
